intro: Vincetoxicum leucanthum, commonly known as white angel's trumpet, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, white, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant has smooth, often hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. It produces capsule fruits that contain toxic seeds, which are used in traditional medicine. Due to its toxicity, it should be handled with care.
